pullRequest.body:
We prove that if `X` is a simplicial set that is `StrictSegal` then `X` is 2-coskeletal, meaning `(coskAdj 2).unit.app X` defines an isomorphism `StrictSegal.cosk2Iso : X ‚âÖ (Truncated.cosk 2).obj ((truncation 2).obj X)`. 

This is proven by demonstrating that `(rightExtensionInclusion X n).IsPointwiseRightKanExtension` holds. 

Co-Authored-By: [Mario Carneiro](https://github.com/digama0) and [Jo√´l Riou](https://github.com/joelriou) 

---
- [ ] depends on: #19492 

This replaces #16782, half of which has already been merged.

Note this file does not currently contain a definition of `n-coskeletal` because it wasn't clear to me which form of that definition would be most useful. My guess is that it should be something like `IsIso ((coskAdj n).unit.app X)`. Please let me know if this is something you'd like me to add or if you have other suggestions.

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|1552|1|erw|

Current commit [6061455069](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/606145506967310336189382dd791bb644c17a45)
Reference commit [0fc63c9122](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/0fc63c9122ae798d30bdba64a7e7bf4f960018e1)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I have tried to improve the code in the branch https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/tree/coskeletal_jriou
see https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/coskeletal_jriou/Mathlib/AlgebraicTopology/SimplicialSet/Coskeletal.lean (which is still a kind of draft, and there is still a not so hard sorry).
Mostly, we may avoid introducing too many auxiliary definitions. Also, when checking equalities between `2`-simplices of strict Segal simplicial sets, it suffices to check two equalities between arrows (as the equalities between vertices can be deduces from these): see the additional ext lemmas at https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/coskeletal_jriou/Mathlib/AlgebraicTopology/SimplicialSet/Path.lean

> see the additional ext lemmas at https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/coskeletal_jriou/Mathlib/AlgebraicTopology/SimplicialSet/Path.lean
Actually, these should be generalized as an `ext` lemma for paths of length `n + 1`.

In general, could you tag your PRs with `t-category-theory` rather than `t-topology`? We do not have `t-algebraic-topology` (nor `t-homology`), but these constructions on simplicial sets, etc, fit much more the `t-category-theory` tag as compared to `t-topology` which is very much related to topological spaces. (Also, `t-topology` is mostly under my radar, but I follow quite closely the contributions in `t-category-theory`.)

@emilyriehl I apologize, I should have warned you about this, but #19349 introduced the lemma suggested by @joelriou to the `master` branch. This is likely the source of your merge conflict now.

I'm happy to help resolve this, although I'm not positive what the best route is. Normally, I would open a PR against your fork resolving the conflict. In this case, I suspect a PR opened against this branch might require a maintainer to merge. I *think* I might be able to push directly to your branch, but that would obviously require some coordination to make sure I don't push anything that conflicts with your work.

Thanks @gio256. The conflict was silly (just two new lemmas in the same place) but your `Path.ext` seemed better/more general than the versions `Path.ext_1` and `Path.ext_2` that @joelriou had defined in a branch of this PR. So I cut those and fixed everything (I think). But if I'm still stuck, I may take you up on your offer of help. Thanks.

@joelriou I've
- merged your branch
- filled in that sorry (with a proof I'm sure needs golfing...)
- bumped mathlib (and replaced your two Path.ext lemmas with `Path.ext'`)
- implemented all the suggestions above with one exception I'll now describe.

I'll now open up a new PR which defines IsCoskeletal at the level of simplicial objects. I'm hoping that will simplify and perhaps speed up the review.
Update: see #19492.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19492~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Indeed, could you introduce a typeclass `X.IsCoskeletal n` for a simplicial object `X` (file `SimplicialObject.Coskeletal`, which may require moving `SimplicialObject` to `SimplicialObject.Basic`). I would suggest the following definition:
```lean
class IsCoskeletal : Prop where
  nonempty_isRightKanExtension :
    Nonempty (X.IsRightKanExtension (ùüô (Truncated.inclusion (n := n).op ‚ãô X)))
```
because this does not require any assumption on the category `C`.
Then, under more assumptions on `C`, you may add `_iff` lemmas relating this to the fact the unit morphism is an isomorphism, for example:
```lean
def isoCoskOfIsCoskeletal [X.IsCoskeletal n] :
    X ‚âÖ (Truncated.cosk n).obj ((truncation n).obj X) := sorry
```

When defining data, it is not recommended to apply too many tactics, especially `simp`. The structure of the code should be like this:
```suggestion
    (rightExtensionInclusion X 2).IsPointwiseRightKanExtensionAt ‚ü®[n]‚ü© where
  lift s x := ran.lift (X := X) s x
  fac := sorry
  uniq := sorry
```
Done (with your branch).
I believe this should be in the `Truncated` namespace.
Done.

```suggestion
noncomputable def isPointwiseRightKanExtensionAt (n : ‚Ñï) :
```
Done (with your branch).

```suggestion
/-- Since `StrictSegal.isPointwiseRightKanExtensionAt` proves that the appropriate
```

We can use dot notation:
```suggestion
    (rightExtensionInclusion X 2).IsPointwiseRightKanExtension :=
```

```suggestion
    X.IsRightKanExtension (ùüô ((inclusion 2).op ‚ãô X)) :=
```

This can be removed: because of the typeclass system, when `X` is strict Segal, it is 2-coskeletal due to the instance above, and then the isomorphism is just `X.isoCoskOfIsCoskeletal 2`.
```suggestion
```

When something is already an instance (here because we already now `nerve C` is strict Segal), it is not necessary to declare it, but in order to point out a fact to the reader, it is advisable to use `example`:
```suggestion
example (C : Type u) [Category.{v} C] :
    SimplicialObject.IsCoskeletal (nerve C) 2 := by infer_instance
```

```suggestion
/-- The natural isomorphism between `nerveFunctor` and `nerveFunctor ‚ãô Truncated.cosk 2` whose
components `nerve C ‚âÖ (Truncated.cosk 2).obj (nerve‚ÇÇ C)` shows that nerves of categories are
2-coskeletal.-/
noncomputable def cosk‚ÇÇIso : nerveFunctor.{u, v} ‚âÖ nerveFunctor‚ÇÇ.{v, u} ‚ãô Truncated.cosk 2 :=
  NatIso.ofComponents (fun C ‚Ü¶ (nerve C).isoCoskOfIsCoskeletal 2)
    (fun _ ‚Ü¶ (coskAdj 2).unit.naturality _)
```

Then, you may remove the definition `cosk2NatTrans`, because it is always an isomorphism.
You may also fix the definition I had made of `nerveFunctor` by making the universes explicit:
```lean
def nerveFunctor : Cat.{v, u} ‚•§ SSet where
```
Then, this will fix the order of the universes, and in this file `Coskeletal.lean`, the definition would become:
```lean
noncomputable def cosk‚ÇÇIso : nerveFunctor.{v, u} ‚âÖ nerveFunctor‚ÇÇ.{v, u} ‚ãô Truncated.cosk 2 :=
```
(As this may be confusing, please let me know if this does not fully make sense to you.)

```suggestion
In this file, we prove that if `X` is `StrictSegal` then `X` is 2-coskeletal,
i.e. `X ‚âÖ (cosk 2).obj X`. In particular, nerves of categories are 2-coskeletal.
```

I think the RHS would be better in this version:
```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma mkOfLe_refl {n} (j : Fin (n + 1)) :
    mkOfLe j j (by omega) = [1].const [n] j := Hom.ext_one_left _ _
```
(This lemma does not seem to be used in the main result here.)

pullRequest.title: feat(AlgebraicTopology/SimplicialSet): StrictSegal simplicial sets are 2-coskeletal
